attributes.action: Maintain face masks in shops and public transport
attributes.additional_details:
1. Infection is rising. Masks offer some protection. 

2. Masks do not harm the economy, but  help by protecting shop and transport staff and commuters.

3. We might choose a mask, but the choices of others will be imposed on us - the opposite of personal freedom and responsibilty, especially for  the vulnerable and fearful. 

4. Vaccinations : make masks optional when the programme is complete.  It insults all the  commitment, sacrifice and tragedy if gesture politics wreck the few remaining weeks before vaccination protects us all.
attributes.background: We urge Government to keep the legal requirement for masks in shops and on public transport until vaccinations are practically complete.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Keep requirement to wear a face covering in shops & supermarkets after July 19th
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590829

Keep face covering mandatory in indoor public settings beyond 19th July 2021
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590616

Keep face masks mandatory for public transport after the lifting of restrictions
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590694

Keep mandatory face coverings in supermarkets and on public transport
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590836
